title: FRQ Score
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples and to score the response.

General Considerations

The response must correctly describe the data in the graph.

For Task A, the response must correctly identify the total number of protests (to the nearest thousand) when Xi Jinping became leader.

For Task B, the response must correctly describe the change in protests resulting in detentions after Xi Jinping became leader.

For Task C, the response must correctly explain why an authoritarian government might try to prevent protests.

For Task D, the response must correctly draw a conclusion as to why the Chinese government allows a certain number of protests to occur without detention.

For Task E, the response must correctly explain why the Chinese government has responded to a specific protest movement between 2009 and 2016.
descriptions: The response accomplishes none of the tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes one of the tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes two of the tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes three of the tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes four of the tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes all five of the tasks set by the question.
